X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=Yz5oVC913JPEc6IaoDCDoJGWiCq6vejVoOOnCSJe1pVn

Here at the Internet Archive, we essentially never 'unroll' W/ARCs to 
hierarchical directories like this. Instead, our analysis and web-access 
all operate on the aggregate files, pulling ranges out (and serving them 
via Wayback Machine installations) on the fly, using prebuilt indexes.

Thus we have no standard or recommended tool for doing this. Someone 
else might.

For simple cases it should be a simple tool to write. Complications can 
arise, though, because not all URL paths are trivially representable as 
file-paths. If your ultimate hope is to use a web browser to view the 
files on disk, careful choice of conventions for mapping URLs to files 
is important, and the file contents may need rewriting as well to make 
URLs relative to the file's new home.

(The externally-contributed MirrorWriterProcessor included in Heritrix 
is one attempt at writing web content directly to such filesystem 
hierarchies, though I don't have any experience with it, so I don't how 
well it works in practice.)

- Gordon @ IA

On 2/11/11 4:45 AM, virginie wrote:
> Sorry, I rephrase my question.
> So, I unpacked my whole WARC-File and so I would like to write the result (issue of the Extractor) on my File system into a structured directory like for example

> www.edu/2010/1001/pdf/Dokument.pdf
> www.edu/2010/1002/pdf/Dokument.pdf
> www.edu/2010/1003/pdf/Dokument.pdf
> please do you have any Idea?
